subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing Exception classes
msgSnippet: ... I forgot to zoom in on this one. So sometimes it s super(message, cause); and sometimes it s super(message); initCause(cause); and sometimes it s something
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:

> Typically I try to give my constructors correct exception chaining
> functionality in both Java 1.3 and earlier and Java 1.4 and later.

I forgot to zoom in on this one.

So sometimes it's

super(message, cause);

and sometimes it's

super(message);
initCause(cause);

and sometimes it's something else....

Yes, I can see how that would drive me to drink, then write tests once I
sober up.

Thanks for the example!
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
